class simba.ui.tkinter_functions.TwoOptionQuestionPopUp(question: str, option_one: str, option_two: str, title: str, link: Optional[str] = None)[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

Helpe to create a two-option question tkinter pop up window (e.g., YES/NO).

Parameters:

  • question (str) ‚Äì Question to present to the user. E.g., DO YOU WANT TO PROCEED?.

  • option_one (str) ‚Äì The first user option. E.g., YES.

  • option_one ‚Äì The second user option. E.g., NO.

  • title (str) ‚Äì The window titel in the top banner of the pop-up. E.g., A QUESTION FOR YOU!.

  • link (Optional[str]) ‚Äì If not None, then a link to documentation presenting background info about the user choices.

run(selected_option)[source]ÔÉÅ

simba.ui.user_defined_pose_creator moduleÔÉÅ

class simba.ui.user_defined_pose_creator.PoseConfigCreator(pose_name: str, no_animals: int, img_path: Union[str, PathLike], bp_list: List[str], animal_id_int_list: List[str])[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: PlottingMixin

Class for creating user-defined pose-estimation pipeline in SimBA through a GUI interface.

..seealso::

GitHub tutorial/documentation.

Parameters:

  • pose_name (str) ‚Äì Name of the user-defined pose-estimation setting.

  • no_animals (str) ‚Äì Number of animals in the user-defined pose-estimation setting.

  • img_path (str) ‚Äì Path to image representation of user-defined pose-estimation setting

  • bp_list (List[str]) ‚Äì Body-parts in the user-defined pose-estimation setting.

  • animal_id_int_list (List[int]) ‚Äì Integers representing the animal ID which the body-parts belong to.

Examples:

>>> pose_config_creator = PoseConfigCreator(pose_name="My_test_config", no_animals=2, img_path='simba/splash_050122.png', bp_list=['Ear', 'Nose', 'Left_ear', 'Ear', 'Nose', 'Left_ear'], animal_id_int_list= [1, 1, 1, 2, 2, 2])
>>> pose_config_creator.launch()
launch()[source]ÔÉÅ
save()[source]ÔÉÅ

simba.ui.video_info_ui moduleÔÉÅ

class simba.ui.video_info_ui.VideoInfoTable(config_path: str)[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: ConfigReader, PopUpMixin

Create GUI that allows users to modify resolutions, fps, and pixels-per-mm interactively of videos within the SimBA project. Data is stored within the project_folder/logs/video_info.csv file in the SimBA project.

Parameters:

config_file_path (str) ‚Äì path to SimBA project config file in Configparser format

..seealso::

Tutorial.

Example:

>>> video_info_gui = VideoInfoTable(config_path='MyProjectConfig')
>>> video_info_gui.create_window()
>>> video_info_gui.main_frm.mainloop()
create_window()[source]ÔÉÅ
